column1: Grading and staging are terms used by doctors to describe tumors (cancer).
Grading is performed by a pathologist who examines the cancerous cells under a microscope and assesses the aggressiveness of these cells.
You may have different grades of cancer in one biopsy sample.
- Localized prostate cancer: The cancer is contained within the prostate gland and has not spread to nearby tissues or elsewhere in the body.
- Your doctor may also use the TNM staging system.
It means a patient has a normal prostate exam (digital rectal exam) but an abnormal PSA blood test.
These results may be able to show how many areas of the prostate gland have cancer.
